extendedInfo.description: âIf you see something say somethingâ for smartphones.The MBTA See Say App offers riders a quick and discreet method for reporting suspicious activity directly and instantaneously to Transit Police. Using this app, riders can send the MBTA Transit Police pictures, text messages, and locations of suspicious activity. From the App home screen, riders have two easy options for contacting Transit Police: * The âReport a Problemâ button allows riders to send text or photos directly to Transit Police. To ensure discretion, the camera flash is automatically disabled when photos are taken through the app. When reporting an issue, riders can select station locations and report categories to assist transit police. * The âCall Transit Policeâ button will connect customers directly to Transit Police. The application is designed for the T. If you send a report in an area without cellular connectivity, it will be stored and sent when connectivity returns. The system is also design to send text before pictures so that Transit Police get reports as quickly as possible. â¨ Additional Features Riders can sign up to receive MBTA T-Alerts through the app to be notified of service delays and disruptions. BOLO alerts. (Be On the Look Out) SeeSay may also display alerts from the MBTA. For example, SeeSay may display information about a missing person, such as where they were last seen. If you see this person you may call or send a report to Transit Police.Key WordsMBTA,DHS,see something say something,911,transportation,emergency,alert,T-Alerts,train,bus,elerts

reviews.title: Okay...
reviews.comment: DROID X2. Seems to work okay, except for alerts. I only get alerts when I manually run the app, or when I restart my phone. Less than helpful when dealing with time sensitive information.
reviews.author: Zak Kosan

reviews.title: Never used not a stitch
reviews.comment: I haven\'t used it and am thinking about uninstalling it.  It self starts don\'t like that.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: T-Alerts don\'t work - Galaxy Nexus 4.1.1
reviews.comment: Check boxes for T alerts won\'t stay checked.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Innovative
reviews.comment: Well done! Nice and easy to use UI that is far nicer looking than most gov\'ment based apps. No obligation to ID oneself, providing anonymity if you want. It also does service alerts for all MBTA busses, rails and boats! This is a great way to allocate resources more efficiently making transit a safer, more enjoyable experience. All T riders with a smart phone should have this app on standby...
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Hope an update fixes
reviews.comment: Force closes every time I open.  Samsung Exhibit II using CM9
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Works great as far as I can tell...
reviews.comment: ...However, the true test will be in having to actually use it (which I hope is never the case). Otherwise, a great tool to have on standby.   (Pantech Crossover)
